androidx.test.internal.util

Class Checks

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.test.internal.util.Checks

  • public final class Checks
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for checking null references, method arguments, and thread state to simplify other library code.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkArgument(boolean expression)
      Throw an IllegalArgumentException when expression is false.
      static void checkArgument(boolean expression, java.lang.Object errorMessage)
      Throw an IllegalArgumentException when expression is false with the specified errorMessage.
      static void checkArgument(boolean expression, java.lang.String errorMessageTemplate, java.lang.Object... errorMessageArgs)
      Throw an IllegalArgumentException when expression is false with the message formatted by errorMessageTemplate and errorMessageArgs.
      static void checkMainThread()
      Checks if the current thread is the main thread, otherwise throws.
      static void checkNotMainThread()
      Checks if the current thread is not the main thread, otherwise throws.
      static <T> T checkNotNull(T reference) 
      static <T> T checkNotNull(T reference, java.lang.Object errorMessage) 
      static <T> T checkNotNull(T reference, java.lang.String errorMessageTemplate, java.lang.Object... errorMessageArgs) 
      static void checkState(boolean expression) 
      static void checkState(boolean expression, java.lang.Object errorMessage)
      Throw an IllegalStateException when expression is false with the specified errorMessage.
      static void checkState(boolean expression, java.lang.String errorMessageTemplate, java.lang.Object... errorMessageArgs)
      Throw an IllegalStateException when expression is false with the specified errorMessage.

      • checkMainThread

        public static void checkMainThread()
        Checks if the current thread is the main thread, otherwise throws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if current thread is not the main thread.

      • checkNotMainThread

        public static void checkNotMainThread()
        Checks if the current thread is not the main thread, otherwise throws.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if current thread is the main thread.
